result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. SHALLOW was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule II Narcotics (Percocet), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, to commence upon the completion of sentence in 15 CF 617.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Plea date scheduled for 01/15/2016, at 3:30 p.m.

Count 3 - Deliver Schedule II Narcotics (Percocet) - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1, 2, 4, and 5.   Motion granted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Sentencing hearing is set for 11-03-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Report to be filed by 10-09-15.   Court orders defendant to submit DNA sample.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 8-25-2015 at 2 p.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-09-15 at 3:45 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-20-15 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 05-11-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety, he is not to possess any prescription drugs not prescribed to him and have no contact with Bradley Newcomer and Jarrod Hetue as well as the residence's where they reside.  Bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
